events.text: Dak!!
Hey Ollie. What’s up?
I’m freaking out!
Yeah, I can see that. Do your breathing.
Don’t tell me to do my breathing, this is serious!
What’s wrong?
Look around! We’re trapped in this underdeveloped blank tech doomspace!
“Doomspace”?

events.question: Yeah, what else would ya call it?!

events.text: It’s just an alpha build, Ollie. The game isn’t even close to done yet.
Then why do we exist? Why are we here?
To just… you know, try stuff out. To chat and stuff
B-but… Just to chat? Is that really the sole purpose of our existence?
The boys are trying to figure out how dialogue options work. It’s important.
We’re just here to say some lines? Ugh. Lame.
It’s a bit more complicated than that. I could have said at least three other things.
So do you want me to… say the same thing when you talk with me again, so you can try the other dialogue options?
Nah. We also need to test you saying a different line repeatedly after this dialogue tree is done. So when I come up to you again, say something else.
Okay, okay, fine.
This is The Hardsell, Ollie. Come on. Our homebase? Where we live?
This? This is it?!
Are you okay? Did you hit your head again?
Yes, but that’s not the point. Look at this dump! There’s hardly anything here!
It could use some decorations, I admit. We should hit up Hobby Lobby or something.
There’s a bigger problem. How are we supposed to go to the bathroom?
There’s gotta be a functional toilet here somewhere. I’ll look around.
Well hurry up. I saw Ted’s latest blender model and it makes me wanna shit.
It’s called GODOT. It’s an open-source engine.
Yeah, b-but why aren’t we using Unity? Or Unreal?
Because they take a sizable portion of your profits when the game is released.
Ah yeah, that sucks. You’re right.
GODOT is fine. It’s Python, or whatever. It’s fine.
There is something undeniably sexy about using an open-source engine for your game.
We’re gonna be GODOT pioneers, dude. It’s gonna be a selling point of our game.
For nerds maybe. I doubt normies are gonna care that much. But you’re right. Open source is cool. It’s like… the principal of the matter, you know?
Yeah. The principal of… doing things yourself. Or something.
Except GODOT has tons of people working together to develop it.
Yeah but… together, separately.
Also together together, sometimes.
Decentralized. Is that the word?
Yeah that sounds nice. Decentralized.
Decentralized. Sounds nice.
It’s like a… purgatory of some kind.
So do we need to do something to get outta here? Like, learn an important lesson about ourselves and the world?
Maybe.
Or maybe it’s just a matter of time before we’re… released.
Or maybe we’re here forever.
Oh God!!
Relax. If we are stuck here forever, freaking out about it isn’t gonna change anything.
Oh God, oh jeez!! What are we gonna do?! They don’t even have Xbox!
They don’t even have physics yet.
No - NO PHYSICS?!!?
Yeah. Try to jump.
I-I can’t… uuuuugh… I can’t jump, Dak!!
Yep. No physics.
AAAAaaaaah!!
